commit_message:
Fix CephFS snapshot cloning scenario test

When unmounting a share with the kernel
client, the target directory must be what
we used during the mount operation.

This patch adds a create-share-from-snapshot
scenario test for the ceph-fuse client, and
drops the redundant 'ip_version' attribute
to test classes that was added in the
test reorganization patch earlier [1]

[1] I7e63434e745cc1c2a5e8aaccc20f7c31404742d9
Change-Id: I9e373c658bf8aefa5763b7bb58637969e5253312
Closes-Bug: #1921369
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

subject: Listen RabbitMQ on all available container networks
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-05 14:50:43.000000000', 'files': ['inventory/group_vars/rabbitmq_all.yml'], 'message': 'Listen RabbitMQ on all available container networks

For usecase with Trove, it is important that rabbit listen on dbaas
interface, which is not the case with current setup.

That from other side exposes risk of listening on not intended
interfaces, but we assume that no "wrong" networks should be passed
inside RabbitMQ containers.

Change-Id: I1559e63e8cf1c767dc2d14940f0d04d52a372242
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Listen RabbitMQ on all available container networks

For usecase with Trove, it is important that rabbit listen on dbaas
interface, which is not the case with current setup.

That from other side exposes risk of listening on not intended
interfaces, but we assume that no "wrong" networks should be passed
inside RabbitMQ containers.

Change-Id: I1559e63e8cf1c767dc2d14940f0d04d52a372242

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: Ib47a387f15e358e15104fd1cf37e53e61c92ce61

commit_message:
skip write to share created from snap for CEPHFS

The test case in question uses only IP access for the VM
that mounts and writes to shares, which does not workk for
native CephFS shares.  Skip the test case until CEPHFS auth
can be used for this test case.

Also update the comment for the corresponding and already
skipped CIFS test case to refer to our current bug tracking
the issue.

Related-Bug: #1921369

Change-Id: I806fd72b1b5e06e6d679ff71c6ee70ce88a4acd2

commit_message:
Use venv_tag and fix constraint

There was an issue when adjutant didn't use venv_tag that resulted in
broken venv.
We should use proper venv_tag while installing services.

Additionally we fix constraints to use valid egg and install correct
adjutant version

Change-Id: Ib5074969c8c5cbd60f45dcc100cb0cdb9c17662e
(cherry picked from commit e1245d8ec706ff9b1632052cf812698eea2da6d3)

commit_message:
Install spice-html5 from source for RedHat

CentOS used to have spice-html5 package in epel, but it's not the case
for CentOS 8 or Stream. Thus, we need to install SPICE from git repo
even for distro installs.

Change-Id: If435ba24dbdf12450cead70e0e1eaecc50f46470
Closes-Bug: #1923183

commit_message:
Use uWSGI for trove-api

This migrate trove-api to usage of the uwsgi from native service to
align with other service way of deployment and since that's how service
is tested in devstack.

commit_message:
Remove nova console variables

Bunch of variables that were related to nova consoles were missused or
unneded at all.
Here we deprecate and remove them, along with
fixing behaviour to disable spice agent functionality.

Change-Id: I28f6d733db689eab879ae5939d1236e7c0d5f521
Closes-Bug: #1923184

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I9d26b1b4a14360a8b38d6df19621b474c6391de9

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix FDB table not registered in OvnSbIdl

With MAC learning a new table FDB has been added to OVN [0]. It needs to
be registered into OvnSbIdl so that it is recognized.

[0] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/6ec3b12590f9193659d549e30d96b1a22bbb1288

Related-Bug: #1904412
Change-Id: If815965f538b764cca4cc31b83ef5f4d4a50fc20
Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 662cd600753476a4f64df64361a0d31ecf54a1ec)

commit_message:
Re-add nova_dhcp_domain variable

It still makes sense to carry a variable for defining dns_domain
since deployers will be able to control them with single variable
for all services.

Closes-Bug: #1922703
Change-Id: I2be47100ce701e71dda2fe4e8ca58a7b6cad529c

subject: Run tests against localhost and container
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-29 14:46:22.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test.yml'], 'message': 'Run tests against localhost and container

Use localhost and container1 as proper targets for the test playbook
rather than a combination of import_tasks/delegate_to for container1.

The previous code did not run the imported tasks against container1,
but instead a second time against localhost. This makes the handlers
checking the output from ansible diff fail as on the second run
against localhost there are no changes, giving an empty diff.

Changing the test play targets to localhost:container1 makes it more
obvious that the whole test playbook should be run against the host
and the container. It is not clear from the old code if the original
intent was to specifically test config_template tasks delegated from
the host to a container.

Change-Id: Ibc72868d9957567fe86a9d3205a80ec33441baff
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Run tests against localhost and container

Use localhost and container1 as proper targets for the test playbook
rather than a combination of import_tasks/delegate_to for container1.

The previous code did not run the imported tasks against container1,
but instead a second time against localhost. This makes the handlers
checking the output from ansible diff fail as on the second run
against localhost there are no changes, giving an empty diff.

Changing the test play targets to localhost:container1 makes it more
obvious that the whole test playbook should be run against the host
and the container. It is not clear from the old code if the original
intent was to specifically test config_template tasks delegated from
the host to a container.

Change-Id: Ibc72868d9957567fe86a9d3205a80ec33441baff

commit_message:
Add new tripleo-latest-packages-version playbook

This patch adds a new TripleO specific playbook which will call the
check_latest_packages_version role hosted in validations-common. This
playbook will test if the python3-tripleoclient package is at its latest
version on the Undercloud before starting an upgrade.

Note1: The check-latest-packages-versions validation hosted in
validations-common will be refactored to only test non TripleO packages.

Note2: The documentation automation has been modified to point to the
external role official documentation.

Depends-on: b7b6b3f3c80ead9303c8ab828465a085f2580682
Depends-on: 07c1e0f9b892be3494c99ba21a614e92c8c366bc

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I606f650029dd4daad7dc7aac248c388130e9d503
(cherry picked from commit eb21b9d24f30144ebbb6dabe1a46f23de2bc8e11)

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix FDB table not registered in OvnSbIdl

With MAC learning a new table FDB has been added to OVN [0]. It needs to
be registered into OvnSbIdl so that it is recognized.

Related-Bug: #1904412

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-07 15:32:45.000000000', 'files': ['sync/tasks/mq_setup.yml'], 'message': "Run notify setup when setup_host differs

There's a usecase, where all datasets might be the same, except
setup_hosts. For example, when we use isolated rabbitmq cluster for RPC
but shared one for notifications. And we have same set of users
and vhosts there. In current state setup won't be performed, since
vhosts and users are the same.

Change-Id: Ib5c44327d5f1edc25bace79fdd057adabb0b4c14
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Run notify setup when setup_host differs

There's a usecase, where all datasets might be the same, except
setup_hosts. For example, when we use isolated rabbitmq cluster for RPC
but shared one for notifications. And we have same set of users
and vhosts there. In current state setup won't be performed, since
vhosts and users are the same.

Change-Id: Ib5c44327d5f1edc25bace79fdd057adabb0b4c14

commit_message:
Fix haproxy logging

Due to error during migration to journald [1], rsyslog config has
remained intact, which caused logs from journald being copied to
regular logfile, without proper logrotate.

Now we're fixing this and dropping rsyslog config as well.

This will affect only ppl that are upgrading their environments since
Stein

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/672039/4/tasks/haproxy_post_install.yml#b38

Change-Id: I01689bbb3f331b4d8d4afe9d096a4213072ad7c0

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: I50080434a5a11226300eb699fd31103c5e9f5e28

[{'created': '2020-09-11 09:37:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Port several legacy tempest jobs to Zuul v3

- cinder-tempest-lvm-multibackend is the simple LVM multibackend job
  and replaces legacy-tempest-dsvm-lvm-multibackend.
- replace cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican with
  cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican provided by
  cinder-tempest-plugins;
- replace legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-nfs with
  devstack-plugin-nfs-tempest-full, now provided by
  devstack-plugin-nfs.

The original review added a new cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest job
which is not relevant here because cinderlib is not available
on stein. It also removed legacy-tempest-dsvm-zeromq-multibackend,
which has been deleted in the meantime.

	.zuul.yaml
	playbooks/legacy/cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican/run.yaml
 	playbooks/tempest-and-cinderlib-run.yaml
- .zuul.yaml in master contains new jobs (for example, the imported legacy
  grenade jobs, which haven't been backported so far);
- playbooks/legacy/cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican/run.yaml is not needed
  anymore;
- playbooks/tempest-and-cinderlib-run.yaml is not relevant as cinderlib
  is supported from train only.

", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Port several legacy tempest jobs to Zuul v3

- cinder-tempest-lvm-multibackend is the simple LVM multibackend job
  and replaces legacy-tempest-dsvm-lvm-multibackend.
- replace cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican with
  cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican provided by
  cinder-tempest-plugins;
- replace legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-nfs with
  devstack-plugin-nfs-tempest-full, now provided by
  devstack-plugin-nfs.

The original review added a new cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest job
which is not relevant here because cinderlib is not available
on stein. It also removed legacy-tempest-dsvm-zeromq-multibackend,
which was deleted in the meantime.
Finally, in stein and earlier branches this change replaces
the old dependency on a cinder-tempest-plugin fix to the cinderlib
functional test runner, but on a refactoring of cinder-tempest-plugin
which disables cinderlib testing for those older branches.

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml
	playbooks/legacy/cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican/run.yaml
 	playbooks/tempest-and-cinderlib-run.yaml
- .zuul.yaml in master contains new jobs (for example, the imported legacy
  grenade jobs, which haven't been backported so far);
- playbooks/legacy/cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican/run.yaml is not needed
  anymore;
- playbooks/tempest-and-cinderlib-run.yaml is not relevant as cinderlib
  is supported from train only.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/778448
Change-Id: Icdafaf55494b6dd74ec31c3572d7344fcc028166
(cherry picked from commit 9ab1ff0059dc324ea73d0444103fa71c97fb517a)
(cherry picked from commit fc59ea9e6eadda2bce2f77859e5043656c86a3ec)
